intro: Isopyrum henryi, commonly known as Henry's isopyrum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are greenish-white and appear in late summer, followed by the production of small, three-lobed berries. Isopyrum henryi is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and rocky slopes.
